case_vignette:
An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his foster mother because of complaints from his teachers regarding poor performance at school for the past 8 months. He does not listen to their instructions, often talks during class, and rarely completes his school assignments. He does not sit in his seat in the classroom and often cuts in line at the cafeteria. His foster mother reports that he runs around a lot inside the house and refuses to help his sister with chores and errands. He frequently interrupts his foster mother's conversations with others and talks excessively. She has found him trying to climb on the roof on multiple occasions. He was placed in foster care because of neglect by his biological parents 3 years ago. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. Mental status examination shows a neutral affect. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I often talk during class, don't listen to instructions, and rarely complete my school assignments. I also run around a lot and refuse to help with chores. I frequently interrupt conversations and have been found trying to climb on the roof.
How old are you?
I am 8 years old.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for the past 8 months.
Have you experienced any recent major changes or stresses in your life, such as moving, changing schools, or family issues?
Yes, I was placed in foster care because of neglect by my biological parents 3 years ago.
Has there been any improvement or change in your symptoms with any specific activities or routines?
No, there has not been any improvement or change in my symptoms with specific activities or routines.
Final Diagnosis: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

Additionally, the child tends to run around excessively and refuses to participate in household chores. Frequent interruptions in conversations and risky behaviors like attempting to climb on the roof have also been reported. These symptoms have persisted for the past 8 months. The child was placed in foster care 3 years ago due to neglect by biological parents. There has been no noted improvement or change in the child's symptoms with specific activities or routines.
